intro: Pulsatilla grandis subsp. gotlandica, commonly known as Gotlandian pasqueflower, is a rare and delicate perennial plant native to the Baltic region. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are trifoliate, with a hairy texture, and the stems are usually unbranched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
